abstract.t: For operational simplification of "sessionless" applications using BFD, in this document we present procedures for "unsolicited BFD" that allow a BFD session to be initiated by only one side, and be established without explicit per-session configuration or registration by the other side (subject to certain per-interface or per-router policies). We also introduce a new YANG module to configure and manage "unsolicited BFD". The YANG module in this document conforms to the Network Management Datastore Architecture (NMDA) [RFC8342].
